Problematic assumption: The claim is based on the assumption that Congress will reinstate the estate tax, which is seen as a problematic assumption by Democrats.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that the $290 million structural surplus is not real.
Exist alternative explanation: Democrats argue that the Republicans are using the assumption of the estate tax reinstatement to make the budget look better than it actually is, suggesting that there may be alternative explanations for the surplus.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the nonpartisan Legislative Fiscal Bureau determined that the budget would result in a surplus of $292 million.
Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the impact of the assumption about the estate tax reinstatement on the overall surplus.
Understate: The claim may be understating the actual surplus by suggesting that it is closer to $75 million instead of $290 million.
